docs.text:
Use this page to explore key company types. Expand only what you need.

📦 Sweet Shop - **Tier:** Starter - **Strengths:** Low upkeep, beginner-friendly - **Best For:** Passive income without staff drama - **Drawbacks:** Weak XP gains 📰 News Stand - **Tier:** Starter - **Strengths:** Easy XP for workers - **Best For:** Hands-off progression - **Drawbacks:** Not profit-focused 🍴 Restaurant - **Tier:** Starter/Intermediate - **Strengths:** Scalable, entry-level training - **Best For:** Players learning staff mechanics - **Drawbacks:** Mid-tier rewards 📺 TV Studio - **Tier:** Intermediate - **Strengths:** Boosts INT stat gains for staff - **Best For:** Trainers and knowledge builds - **Drawbacks:** Niche, needs coordination 📦 Logistics - **Tier:** Intermediate - **Strengths:** Chain bonuses, steady payouts - **Best For:** Passive players and faction loopers - **Drawbacks:** Limited scaling 🕯️ Candle Shop - **Tier:** Intermediate - **Strengths:** Low cost, solid returns early - **Best For:** Budget-conscious owners - **Drawbacks:** Doesn’t scale well 🪑 Furniture Store - **Tier:** Advanced - **Strengths:** Profitable, staff-friendly - **Best For:** Medium/large teams, low micromanagement - **Drawbacks:** High startup cost 🎮 Game Development - **Tier:** Advanced - **Strengths:** Top-tier income potential - **Best For:** Active managers, big ambitions - **Drawbacks:** Requires attention, fragile if neglected 🥩 Meat Warehouse - **Tier:** Advanced - **Strengths:** Strong stat perks, power gains - **Best For:** Combat builds and serious chainers - **Drawbacks:** High effort, complex staffing

docs.title: 📨 Join a Company
docs.text: Whether you're new to the game or between jobs, this guide helps you find and join the right company for your goals.

docs.title: 🔎 Step 1: Search for Open Companies
docs.text:
💼 Where to look
  • Torn Job Market: Visit Companies → Job Listings
  • Forums: Check the "Jobs & Recruitment" section
  • Direct Invites: Get noticed on Discord or from factionmates
  • Company Ads: Often posted on player profiles or classifieds

docs.title: 🤔 Step 2: What to Look For
docs.text:
🧩 Key factors to consider
  • Company Type: What perks/stats does it train or boost?
  • Daily Pay: Does it offer cash or points bonuses?
  • Expectations: Are you expected to train, maintain activity, or be social?
  • Level of Upgrades: Bigger companies often have more perks unlocked
  • Staff Size: Smaller teams might train slower, but feel tighter-knit

docs.title: 💡 Step 3: Match to Your Playstyle
docs.text:
📚 If you're in learning mode
  • Look for: Sweet Shop, Music Store, Restaurant
  • Focus: Simpler perks, less pressure, passive bonuses
💪 If you're training for stats
  • Endurance → Mechanic
  • Dexterity → Firework Stand
  • Strength → Restaurant
  • Intelligence → Law Firm
💸 If you're in it for money
  • Look for companies with:
    • Daily payouts (cash or points)
    • Sales/performance bonuses
    • Perks like faster drug cooldown or weapon damage boosts

docs.title: 🧾 Step 4: Apply or Reach Out
docs.text:
📝 Options to join
  • Apply directly through the company’s page
  • DM the director and express your interest (mention your stats or goals)
  • Join via referral if offered by a faction friend or connection

docs.title: 🛡️ Step 5: Red Flags to Avoid
docs.text:
🚩 Watch out for...
  • Companies with zero perks or no upgrades
  • Long-term staff inactivity
  • Directors who never reply to messages
  • Listings that promise unrealistic perks (like training 2x faster with no proof)

💬 Still unsure? Ask your faction for guidance—or use Analyze My Profile to find a company that matches you.

docs.title: 🔑 Load Your Torn API Key
docs.text:
To personalize your assistant experience, you can load your Torn public API key. This unlocks smart, stat-based suggestions tailored to your profile.

🛡️ Read-only access only Your key allows us to view stats like Strength, Intelligence, Job, Rank, and Company—but we can’t change anything. We don't store or transmit it.

docs.title: 📍 Where to Find Your API Key
docs.text:
1. Go to: https://www.torn.com/preferences.php#tab=api
  2. Locate the Public API Key section
  3. Copy the key (looks like abc123...)

docs.title: 📥 Paste your API key below (or share it privately for testing):
docs.text:
API Key: abc123yourkeyhere...

(For local testing, this can be stored in a temporary session file or passed between pages manually.)

docs.title: 🔓 Once connected, unlock:
docs.text:
• 🧬 Analyze My Profile  Use real stats to find your top-fit company types

  • 🚀 Start or Buy a Company  See which companies suit your budget and INT level

  • 📨 Join a Company  Match company requirements based on your stats

Prefer not to use your key? No problem — Continue Without Stats

docs.title: 🧬 Analyze My Profile
docs.text: This page matches you to the best company types based on your stats, play style, budget, and goals. If you've loaded your API key, the assistant will use real data. Otherwise, you can browse manually below.

docs.title: 📊 Stat-Based Recommendations
docs.text:
💪 Strength Under 100
  • Try: Sweet Shop, Music Store, News Stand
  • Why: Learn company basics without relying on stats
  • Perks: Simple upgrades, low upkeep
🧠 Intelligence 250–399
  • Try: Restaurant, Game Dev, TV Studio
  • Why: Meet base INT to manage most companies
  • Goal: Train to 400 INT to unlock perks
🧠 Intelligence 400+
  • Try: Furniture Store, Firework Stand, Mechanic
  • Why: Max out premium performance
  • Perks: Stat boosts, high profits, powerful upgrades

docs.title: 💰 Budget-Based Paths
docs.text:
💰 Choose your spending tier

Under $100m - Sweet Shop, Music Store, Restaurant

$100m – $500m - Furniture Store, Game Development, Firework Stand

$500m+ - Mechanic, Law Firm, Tech Company

💡 Prices are market-dependent, especially for auctions or upgraded listings

docs.title: 👤 Play Style Match
docs.text:
🎮 Your style, your path
  • Solo / Low Staff: Sweet Shop, Music Store, Firework Stand
  • Team Builder: Game Dev, Furniture Store, Mechanic
  • Passive Profits: Furniture Store, Firework Stand
  • Stat Boosting:
    • Restaurant (STR)
    • Law Firm (INT)
    • Firework Stand (DEX)
    • Mechanic (END)

docs.title: 🎶 Music Store
docs.text:
Your Passive-Earning, Bonus-Dropping Side Hustle

The Music Store thrives on minimal oversight. It's like an indie band with a cult following—quietly profitable, rarely demanding, and surprisingly cool to manage.

docs.title: 🧠 Requirements
docs.text:
• Recommended INT: 100+ for optimal drop frequency
  • Staff: 2–5 ideal (Sales Reps, Manual, or HR mix)
  • Setup Cost: ~$60M–$80M
  • Upkeep: Low to moderate (depends on staff fill rate)

docs.title: 🧰 Suggested Setup
docs.text: Priority Recommendation 🧱 Upgrades Level 1 → Staff Capacity → Item Quality 👥 Staff Roles Sales Reps + Manual for speed 💽 Focus Perks Bonus items, passive income

docs.title: 🎁 Perks Breakdown
docs.text: Perk Effect Unlocks at 🎁 Bonus Item Drops Random item drops from daily activity Level 3+ with 4 staff 💰 Increased Revenue Boost to daily passive income Mid-tier upgrades 🎫 Coupon Generation Potential future perk (depends on meta) Not guaranteed

docs.title: 📈 Tips for Success
docs.text:
• Fill staff early—bonuses scale with activity
  • Use job ads or faction posts to fill fast
  • Combine with faction job perks for optimal profit
  • Low stress even with 0 daily input

docs.title: 🙋 Who Should Run This
docs.text:
✅ Casual or alt accounts ✅ Bonus hunters ✅ Faction support players ❌ Not built for stat gains or fast cash grabs

➡️ 🍝 Try Restaurant instead ➡️ 🏠 Back to Start or Buy

docs.title: Rec restaurant
docs.text: ⬅️ Back to Budget: Under $100m

docs.title: 🍝 Restaurant
docs.text:
Your Strength-Boosting, Money-Making Bistro Boss Build

The Restaurant is a hybrid gem—solid profits, STR training perks, and a familiar layout that scales beautifully with a bit of love and salt.

docs.title: 🧠 Requirements
docs.text:
• Recommended INT: 300+ (for perk scaling)
  • Staff: 5–10 for solid progression
  • Setup Cost: ~$80M–$100M
  • Upkeep: Moderate (as staff grows)

docs.title: 🧰 Suggested Setup
docs.text: Priority Recommendation 🧱 Upgrades Capacity → Staff Quality → Stat Bonus Tier 👥 Staff Roles Sales Reps, Manual Workers, HR 🍖 Focus Perks Strength boost, staff productivity

docs.title: 🎁 Perks Breakdown
docs.text: Perk Effect Unlocks at 🥩 Strength Boost Gym strength +2%–5% Varies w/ upgrades 🍷 Energy w/ Meals Minimal energy regen (thematic) Mid-tier upgrades 🍽️ Bonus Dining Exp Flavor only (no actual effect) Early tier

docs.title: 📈 Tips for Success
docs.text:
• Perfect entry point if you want to mix passive money with stat training
  • Consider hiring faction members for fast loyalty
  • Great launchpad into higher-tier companies later

docs.title: 🙋 Who Should Run This
docs.text:
✅ Hybrid players (stats + money) ✅ Mid-budget builders ✅ New faction leaders testing staff perks ❌ Not ideal for INT training or ultra-low upkeep

➡️ 🎶 Try Music Store instead ➡️ 🏠 Back to Start or Buy

docs.title: 🍬 Sweet Shop
docs.text:
Your Low-Budget, Passive Profit Companion

The Sweet Shop is ideal for solo players or those new to company management. It’s cost-effective, easy to run, and still delivers reliable passive perks.

docs.title: 🧠 Requirements
docs.text:
• Recommended INT: 0+ (great for beginners)
  • Staff: 1–3 (solo-friendly)
  • Upkeep: Very low
  • Setup Cost: ~$40M–$60M

docs.title: 🧰 Suggested Setup
docs.text: Priority Recommendation 🧱 Upgrades Level 1 → Storage → Staff Cap 👥 Staff Roles Director + 1–2 Sales Reps 🎯 Focus Perks Item cooldown, candy drops, energy

docs.title: 🎁 Perks Breakdown
docs.text: Perk Effect Unlocks at 🍬 Candy Drop Occasional candy item drops 3+ staff, Level 3 🕒 Item Cooldown Boost Slight reduction in cooldown timers After Storage Upgrade ⚡ Basic Energy Boost +1 Energy daily (minimal impact) Later upgrades

docs.title: 📈 Tips for Success
docs.text:
• Focus early on Storage to unlock staff slots
  • Don’t chase every perk—scale sustainably
  • Perfect for alt accounts or players with limited time

docs.title: 🙋 Who Should Run This
docs.text:
✅ Solo players ✅ Passive income lovers ✅ Low-maintenance strategy ❌ Not for stat training or max profits
